This is a very empathetically detached interpretation of "why" the Russian invasion of Ukraine has "hijacked" out brain. It's like asking "why does the animal eat the food?" and answering "The enteroendocrine cells of the gastrointestinal tract release ghrelin to the animal's blood stream, activating cells in the anterior pituitary gland and hypothalamic arcuate nucleus, initiating appetite through the neuropeptide Y neurons."

Not only is this answer not usable, but it didn't even answer WHY the animal was hungry. It answered HOW hunger was implemented biologically in the animal. The reason WHY the animal is hungry is because it needs energy to survive and reproduce and it does not eat foot, it will die.

The reason why the Russian attack on Ukraine has hijacked our brains is not because of some implementation detail of the human body. It's because the Russian invasion is a direct threat to our sovereignty and it impacts our ability to properly influence our own future, making it harder for us to survive in the future and making it difficult for us to build a world based on cooperation, rather than domination.

To put in context: This does not have to be a bad thing; It's there because it helped us survive life-threatening situations. However, for those that are not affected by the immediate risks, the same effects still trigger. It is for survivors better to overestimate risk, to get away from danger faster than you can assess all information, and to perceive more threats as life-threatening than there are than to underestimate and be too slow while having more information. 

So the hormonal system will with limited information message a quicker assessment and will activate your instinctive reflexes to get away from danger or sustain the stress/pressure that needs to be endured.

We can consider if we need to hyperfocus and pump adrenaline to stay alert or that we can train ourselves to be calm so we can use that flexibility and broad view to help those that have to deal with a focused view and limited actions to take.


(Not taking away from the usefulness of anger to move what we perceive as having crossed a valuable boundary, that otherwise would not budge.)

Neuroscience trivia is always nice, and I'm sure you meant well with this video. Unfortunately, it comes across as insensitive and a bit condescending.
I'm sure that for any of your Ukrainian viewers, their experience is a lot more serious that just hearing some news of some war, "that makes it hard to focus on anything else". I'm afraid they likely don't have the privilege of just getting off Twitter and binge-watching some show, as some of the commenters here are fortunate enough to do. The same goes for many of us living in the neighbouring countries around Ukraine, privileged as we may be compared to the Ukrainians right now.
The info presented is cool, but it really should be framed differently.
If you want to reference a currently ongoing war, do it in a respectful, constructive way.
If you just want to do a harmless short on the neuroscience of stress responses, you can pick any other less sensitive situation as an example, and leave the heavy topics for other videos!
Sorry for the lecture. Be well, everyone!

I don’t think hijacking is a very good word to use, due to the fact it’s not a conspiracy or something that most likely will not happen (like anxiety thoughts often are) this is a REAL thing and a VERY SCARY thing happening and we need to be informed…..I hope everyone understands what I’m trying to say…..


Edit: arousal isnt the best word either…..its fear/adrenaline and panic


Edit again: Hyper-focus was also used wrong……Hyper focus is a term to describe intense obsession with usually positive interests as seen in Autistic or ADHD or other neuro divergent experiences (for example in my case, as a person who has Learning Disability (Autism NOS) I hyper focus on The Beatles and Paul McCartney that makes me happy and I latch onto it, and know almost if not all facts about this topic and related topics….and I try to constantly learn more about it, listen to their music, and collect merchandise and stuff) but hyper focus can mean different things its a spectrum just like being ND (of course neuro typicals can also have hyper focused interests) my point is……hyper-focus isn’t what the fear over the Russo-Ukraine war is……this is legitimate concern for our fellow humans
